head.citation-title: Effects of the inaccuracy of inventory record and the vendor-managed inventory technique in the supply chain: A beer game simulation
head.abstracts: The Beer Game has been an effective tool to demonstrate the bullwhip effect in the supply chain. This paper expands the original Beer Game by introducing two new dimensions: (i) the inaccuracy of inventory and (ii) the adoption of vendor-managed inventory (VMI) concept. We implement the Beer Game as an online web application allowing players with the Internet access to play with other humans or with the intelligence unit that we built in. Using the intelligent unit, we simulate the game to test the effect of inventory inaccuracy and VMI. We find that at 20% inaccuracy level, the total inventory cost is 65% higher in the traditional supply chain; the retailer fill-rate and the retailer service level are better in the VMI supply chain by 0.36 percentage point and 2.86 percentage point, respectively. The bullwhip amplification is lower by 2.7 times in the VMI supply chain.
